title: Palak Dal | Spinach Lentil Dal | Palakura Pappu | Side Dish
content:
Side dish: Spinach Dal/ Palakura Pappu Servings: 3 Duration: 30 minutes I’m introducing a healthy, delightful Indian dal which is a common recipe in every South Indian home 🏡 . This dal is pretty easy to make which contains skinless split pigeon peas we call them ‘kandipappu’. Lentil is an edible pulse & integrated from legumes family each lentil has their own vital role and when lentil combined with spinach or any other leafy vegetables. It enhances the taste of dal, as I love spinach and a must intake in our daily meal. As I’m sure that you all know the health benefits of spinach/ Palakura if not you can check below details 😊 Nutrition facts of Spinach: Vitamins: A, C, B6, E, K Minerals: Sodium, iron, potassium, magnesium Health Benefits of spinach:
  • High in zinc
  • Low fat & cholesterol 
  • Acts as antioxidants 
  • High fiber 
  • Good for cardiovascular, brain & lowers blood pressure 
  • To retain high iron from spinach, add lemon juice/ vinegar in preparation.
I hope you could try this recipe and enjoy in your daily meal. Let’s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Spinach - 1 bunch - wash twice & chop
  • Red gram/ Skinless Split pigeon peas  - 120 gms
  • Green chillies - 6 - slices
  • Tomato - 1 - Ripped - diced
  • Onion - 1 - Ripped - diced
  • Turmeric Powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 2 Tb sp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/4 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 5
  • Garlic cloves - Peeled off & chopped ( or crush by using mortar & pestle)
  • Water - 200 ml [approx~]
Procedure:
  • Wash red gram lentils twice & Add in pressure cooker along with turmeric powder, chopped green chillies, onion, tomatoes & spinach leaves
  • Add 200 ml water & Cook for 2 whistles over medium heat
  • Let the pressure goes off. Meanwhile, prepare tempering
  • Heat tempering pan, add oil over medium heat
  • Thrn add mustard seeds , cumin seeds, garlic cloves and curry leaves
  • Saute till garlic changes color to light golden brown
  • Turn off heat and keep aside
  • Open pressure cooker and mash well
  • Next add tempering, salt & tamarind pulp
  • Mix well & cook for more 10 minutes over medium heat ( stir occasionally)
  • Turn off heat and serve with rice 🍚 or roti
  • Happy cooking 👩🏻‍🍳 & Have a great day ☀️
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust salt & spicy level according to taste
  • You can make any leafy vegetables dal with the same process
